defs.docs: Utilities for handling sockets

attributes.value: ! Utilities for handling sockets
! This crate is sort of an evolution of the `net2` crate after seeing the
! issues on it over time. The intention of this crate is to provide as direct
! as possible access to the system's functionality for sockets as possible. No
! extra fluff (e.g. multiple syscalls or builders) provided in this crate. As
! a result using this crate can be a little wordy, but it should give you
! maximal flexibility over configuration of sockets.
! # Examples
! ```no_run
! use std::net::SocketAddr;
! use socket2::{Socket, Domain, Type};
! // create a TCP listener bound to two addresses
! let socket = Socket::new(Domain::ipv6(), Type::stream(), None).unwrap();
! socket.bind(&"[::1]:12345".parse::<SocketAddr>().unwrap().into()).unwrap();
! socket.set_only_v6(false);
! socket.listen(128).unwrap();
! let listener = socket.into_tcp_listener();
deny(missing_docs)

defs.name: SockAddr
defs.docs: The address of a socket.

attributes.value: / The address of a socket.
/ `SockAddr`s may be constructed directly to and from the standard library
/ `SocketAddr`, `SocketAddrV4`, and `SocketAddrV6` types.

defs.docs: Constructs a `SockAddr` from its raw components.

attributes.value: / Constructs a `SockAddr` from its raw components.

defs.name: as_inet
defs.docs:
Returns this address as a `SocketAddrV4` if it is in the `AF_INET`
 family.

/ family.

defs.docs:
Returns this address as a `SocketAddrV6` if it is in the `AF_INET6`

/ family.

defs.name: as_std
defs.docs:
Returns this address as a `SocketAddr` if it is in the `AF_INET`
 or `AF_INET6` family, otherwise returns `None`.

attributes.value: / Returns this address as a `SocketAddr` if it is in the `AF_INET`
/ or `AF_INET6` family, otherwise returns `None`.

defs.name: family
defs.docs: Returns this address's family.

attributes.value: / Returns this address's family.

defs.name: len
defs.docs: Returns the size of this address in bytes.

attributes.value: / Returns the size of this address in bytes.

defs.name: as_ptr
defs.docs: Returns a raw pointer to the address.

attributes.value: / Returns a raw pointer to the address.

defs.name: Socket
defs.docs: Newtype, owned, wrapper around a system socket.

attributes.value: / Newtype, owned, wrapper around a system socket.
/ This type simply wraps an instance of a file descriptor (`c_int`) on Unix
/ and an instance of `SOCKET` on Windows. This is the main type exported by
/ this crate and is intended to mirror the raw semantics of sockets on
/ platforms as closely as possible. Almost all methods correspond to
/ precisely one libc or OS API call which is essentially just a "Rustic
/ translation" of what's below.
/ # Examples
/ ```no_run
/ use std::net::SocketAddr;
/ use socket2::{Socket, Domain, Type, SockAddr};
/ // create a TCP listener bound to two addresses
/ let socket = Socket::new(Domain::ipv4(), Type::stream(), None).unwrap();
/ socket.bind(&"127.0.0.1:12345".parse::<SocketAddr>().unwrap().into()).unwrap();
/ socket.bind(&"127.0.0.1:12346".parse::<SocketAddr>().unwrap().into()).unwrap();
/ socket.listen(128).unwrap();
/ let listener = socket.into_tcp_listener();

defs.name: new
defs.value: fn (domain: Domain, type_: Type, protocol: Option<Protocol>) -> io::Result<Socket>
defs.docs: Creates a new socket ready to be configured.

attributes.value: / Creates a new socket ready to be configured.
/ This function corresponds to `socket(2)` and simply creates a new
/ socket, no other configuration is done and further functions must be
/ invoked to configure this socket.

defs.name: into_tcp_stream
defs.docs: Consumes this `Socket`, converting it to a `TcpStream`.

attributes.value: / Consumes this `Socket`, converting it to a `TcpStream`.

defs.name: into_tcp_listener
defs.docs: Consumes this `Socket`, converting it to a `TcpListener`.

attributes.value: / Consumes this `Socket`, converting it to a `TcpListener`.

defs.name: into_udp_socket
defs.docs: Consumes this `Socket`, converting it to a `UdpSocket`.

attributes.value: / Consumes this `Socket`, converting it to a `UdpSocket`.

defs.name: connect
defs.docs: Initiate a connection on this socket to the specified address.

attributes.value: / Initiate a connection on this socket to the specified address.
/ This function directly corresponds to the connect(2) function on Windows
/ and Unix.
/ An error will be returned if `listen` or `connect` has already been
/ called on this builder.

defs.name: connect_timeout
defs.docs:
Initiate a connection on this socket to the specified address, only
 only waiting for a certain period of time for the connection to be
 established.

attributes.value: / Initiate a connection on this socket to the specified address, only
/ only waiting for a certain period of time for the connection to be
/ established.
/ Unlike many other methods on `Socket`, this does *not* correspond to a
/ single C function. It sets the socket to nonblocking mode, connects via
/ connect(2), and then waits for the connection to complete with poll(2)
/ on Unix and select on Windows. When the connection is complete, the
/ socket is set back to blocking mode. On Unix, this will loop over
/ `EINTR` errors.
/ # Warnings
/ The nonblocking state of the socket is overridden by this function -
/ it will be returned in blocking mode on success, and in an indeterminate
/ state on failure.
/ If the connection request times out, it may still be processing in the
/ background - a second call to `connect` or `connect_timeout` may fail.

defs.name: bind
defs.docs: Binds this socket to the specified address.

attributes.value: / Binds this socket to the specified address.
/ This function directly corresponds to the bind(2) function on Windows
/ and Unix.

defs.name: listen
defs.docs:
Mark a socket as ready to accept incoming connection requests using
 accept()

attributes.value: / Mark a socket as ready to accept incoming connection requests using
/ accept()
/ This function directly corresponds to the listen(2) function on Windows
/ and Unix.
/ An error will be returned if `listen` or `connect` has already been
/ called on this builder.

defs.name: accept
defs.docs: Accept a new incoming connection from this listener.

attributes.value: / Accept a new incoming connection from this listener.
/ This function will block the calling thread until a new connection is
/ established. When established, the corresponding `Socket` and the
/ remote peer's address will be returned.

defs.name: local_addr
defs.docs: Returns the socket address of the local half of this TCP connection.

attributes.value: / Returns the socket address of the local half of this TCP connection.

defs.name: peer_addr
defs.docs: Returns the socket address of the remote peer of this TCP connection.

attributes.value: / Returns the socket address of the remote peer of this TCP connection.

defs.name: try_clone
defs.docs: Creates a new independently owned handle to the underlying socket.

attributes.value: / Creates a new independently owned handle to the underlying socket.
/ The returned `TcpStream` is a reference to the same stream that this
/ object references. Both handles will read and write the same stream of
/ data, and options set on one stream will be propagated to the other
/ stream.

defs.name: take_error
defs.docs: Get the value of the `SO_ERROR` option on this socket.

attributes.value: / Get the value of the `SO_ERROR` option on this socket.
/ This will retrieve the stored error in the underlying socket, clearing
/ the field in the process. This can be useful for checking errors between
/ calls.

defs.name: set_nonblocking
defs.docs: Moves this TCP stream into or out of nonblocking mode.

attributes.value: / Moves this TCP stream into or out of nonblocking mode.
/ On Unix this corresponds to calling fcntl, and on Windows this
/ corresponds to calling ioctlsocket.

defs.name: shutdown
defs.docs: Shuts down the read, write, or both halves of this connection.

attributes.value: / Shuts down the read, write, or both halves of this connection.
/ This function will cause all pending and future I/O on the specified
/ portions to return immediately with an appropriate value.

defs.name: recv
defs.docs:
Receives data on the socket from the remote address to which it is
 connected.

attributes.value: / Receives data on the socket from the remote address to which it is
/ connected.
/ The [`connect`] method will connect this socket to a remote address. This
/ method will fail if the socket is not connected.
/ [`connect`]: #method.connect

defs.name: recv_with_flags
defs.docs:
Identical to [`recv`] but allows for specification of arbitrary flags to the underlying
 `recv` call.

attributes.value: / Identical to [`recv`] but allows for specification of arbitrary flags to the underlying
/ `recv` call.
/ [`recv`]: #method.recv

defs.name: recv_out_of_band
defs.docs:
Receives out-of-band (OOB) data on the socket from the remote address to
 which it is connected by setting the `MSG_OOB` flag for this call.

attributes.value: / Receives out-of-band (OOB) data on the socket from the remote address to
/ which it is connected by setting the `MSG_OOB` flag for this call.
/ For more information, see [`recv`], [`out_of_band_inline`].
/ [`recv`]: #method.recv
/ [`out_of_band_inline`]: #method.out_of_band_inline

defs.name: peek
defs.docs:
Receives data on the socket from the remote adress to which it is
 connected, without removing that data from the queue. On success,
 returns the number of bytes peeked.

attributes.value: / Receives data on the socket from the remote adress to which it is
/ connected, without removing that data from the queue. On success,
/ returns the number of bytes peeked.
/ Successive calls return the same data. This is accomplished by passing
/ `MSG_PEEK` as a flag to the underlying `recv` system call.

defs.name: recv_from
defs.docs:
Receives data from the socket. On success, returns the number of bytes
 read and the address from whence the data came.

attributes.value: / Receives data from the socket. On success, returns the number of bytes
/ read and the address from whence the data came.

defs.name: recv_from_with_flags
defs.docs:
Identical to [`recv_from`] but allows for specification of arbitrary flags to the underlying
 `recvfrom` call.

attributes.value: / Identical to [`recv_from`] but allows for specification of arbitrary flags to the underlying
/ `recvfrom` call.
/ [`recv_from`]: #method.recv_from

defs.name: peek_from
defs.docs: Receives data from the socket, without removing it from the queue.

attributes.value: / Receives data from the socket, without removing it from the queue.
/ Successive calls return the same data. This is accomplished by passing
/ `MSG_PEEK` as a flag to the underlying `recvfrom` system call.
/ On success, returns the number of bytes peeked and the address from
/ whence the data came.

defs.name: send
defs.docs: Sends data on the socket to a connected peer.

attributes.value: / Sends data on the socket to a connected peer.
/ This is typically used on TCP sockets or datagram sockets which have
/ been connected.
/ On success returns the number of bytes that were sent.

defs.name: send_with_flags
defs.docs:
Identical to [`send`] but allows for specification of arbitrary flags to the underlying
 `send` call.

attributes.value: / Identical to [`send`] but allows for specification of arbitrary flags to the underlying
/ `send` call.
/ [`send`]: #method.send

defs.name: send_out_of_band
defs.docs:
Sends out-of-band (OOB) data on the socket to connected peer
 by setting the `MSG_OOB` flag for this call.

attributes.value: / Sends out-of-band (OOB) data on the socket to connected peer
/ by setting the `MSG_OOB` flag for this call.
/ For more information, see [`send`], [`out_of_band_inline`].
/ [`send`]: #method.send
/ [`out_of_band_inline`]: #method.out_of_band_inline

defs.name: send_to
defs.docs:
Sends data on the socket to the given address. On success, returns the
 number of bytes written.

attributes.value: / Sends data on the socket to the given address. On success, returns the
/ number of bytes written.
/ This is typically used on UDP or datagram-oriented sockets. On success
/ returns the number of bytes that were sent.

defs.name: send_to_with_flags
defs.docs:
Identical to [`send_to`] but allows for specification of arbitrary flags to the underlying
 `sendto` call.

attributes.value: / Identical to [`send_to`] but allows for specification of arbitrary flags to the underlying
/ `sendto` call.
/ [`send_to`]: #method.send_to

defs.name: ttl
defs.docs: Gets the value of the `IP_TTL` option for this socket.

attributes.value: / Gets the value of the `IP_TTL` option for this socket.
/ For more information about this option, see [`set_ttl`][link].
/ [link]: #method.set_ttl

defs.name: set_ttl
defs.docs: Sets the value for the `IP_TTL` option on this socket.

attributes.value: / Sets the value for the `IP_TTL` option on this socket.
/ This value sets the time-to-live field that is used in every packet sent
/ from this socket.

defs.name: unicast_hops_v6
defs.docs: Gets the value of the `IPV6_UNICAST_HOPS` option for this socket.

attributes.value: / Gets the value of the `IPV6_UNICAST_HOPS` option for this socket.
/ Specifies the hop limit for ipv6 unicast packets

defs.name: set_unicast_hops_v6
defs.docs: Sets the value for the `IPV6_UNICAST_HOPS` option on this socket.

attributes.value: / Sets the value for the `IPV6_UNICAST_HOPS` option on this socket.
/ Specifies the hop limit for ipv6 unicast packets

defs.name: only_v6
defs.docs: Gets the value of the `IPV6_V6ONLY` option for this socket.

attributes.value: / Gets the value of the `IPV6_V6ONLY` option for this socket.
/ For more information about this option, see [`set_only_v6`][link].
/ [link]: #method.set_only_v6

defs.name: set_only_v6
defs.docs: Sets the value for the `IPV6_V6ONLY` option on this socket.

attributes.value: / Sets the value for the `IPV6_V6ONLY` option on this socket.
/ If this is set to `true` then the socket is restricted to sending and
/ receiving IPv6 packets only. In this case two IPv4 and IPv6 applications
/ can bind the same port at the same time.
/ If this is set to `false` then the socket can be used to send and
/ receive packets from an IPv4-mapped IPv6 address.

defs.name: read_timeout
defs.docs: Returns the read timeout of this socket.

attributes.value: / Returns the read timeout of this socket.
/ If the timeout is `None`, then `read` calls will block indefinitely.

defs.name: set_read_timeout
defs.docs: Sets the read timeout to the timeout specified.

attributes.value: / Sets the read timeout to the timeout specified.
/ If the value specified is `None`, then `read` calls will block
/ indefinitely. It is an error to pass the zero `Duration` to this
/ method.

defs.name: write_timeout
defs.docs: Returns the write timeout of this socket.

attributes.value: / Returns the write timeout of this socket.
/ If the timeout is `None`, then `write` calls will block indefinitely.

defs.name: set_write_timeout
defs.docs: Sets the write timeout to the timeout specified.

attributes.value: / Sets the write timeout to the timeout specified.
/ If the value specified is `None`, then `write` calls will block
/ indefinitely. It is an error to pass the zero `Duration` to this
/ method.

defs.name: nodelay
defs.docs: Gets the value of the `TCP_NODELAY` option on this socket.

attributes.value: / Gets the value of the `TCP_NODELAY` option on this socket.
/ For more information about this option, see [`set_nodelay`][link].
/ [link]: #method.set_nodelay

defs.name: set_nodelay
defs.docs: Sets the value of the `TCP_NODELAY` option on this socket.

attributes.value: / Sets the value of the `TCP_NODELAY` option on this socket.
/ If set, this option disables the Nagle algorithm. This means that
/ segments are always sent as soon as possible, even if there is only a
/ small amount of data. When not set, data is buffered until there is a
/ sufficient amount to send out, thereby avoiding the frequent sending of
/ small packets.

defs.name: broadcast
defs.docs: Sets the value of the `SO_BROADCAST` option for this socket.

attributes.value: / Sets the value of the `SO_BROADCAST` option for this socket.
/ When enabled, this socket is allowed to send packets to a broadcast
/ address.

defs.name: set_broadcast
defs.docs: Gets the value of the `SO_BROADCAST` option for this socket.

attributes.value: / Gets the value of the `SO_BROADCAST` option for this socket.
/ For more information about this option, see
/ [`set_broadcast`][link].
/ [link]: #method.set_broadcast

defs.name: multicast_loop_v4
defs.docs: Gets the value of the `IP_MULTICAST_LOOP` option for this socket.

attributes.value: / Gets the value of the `IP_MULTICAST_LOOP` option for this socket.
/ For more information about this option, see
/ [`set_multicast_loop_v4`][link].
/ [link]: #method.set_multicast_loop_v4

defs.name: set_multicast_loop_v4
defs.docs: Sets the value of the `IP_MULTICAST_LOOP` option for this socket.

attributes.value: / Sets the value of the `IP_MULTICAST_LOOP` option for this socket.
/ If enabled, multicast packets will be looped back to the local socket.
/ Note that this may not have any affect on IPv6 sockets.

defs.name: multicast_ttl_v4
defs.docs: Gets the value of the `IP_MULTICAST_TTL` option for this socket.

attributes.value: / Gets the value of the `IP_MULTICAST_TTL` option for this socket.
/ For more information about this option, see
/ [`set_multicast_ttl_v4`][link].
/ [link]: #method.set_multicast_ttl_v4

defs.name: set_multicast_ttl_v4
defs.docs: Sets the value of the `IP_MULTICAST_TTL` option for this socket.

attributes.value: / Sets the value of the `IP_MULTICAST_TTL` option for this socket.
/ Indicates the time-to-live value of outgoing multicast packets for
/ this socket. The default value is 1 which means that multicast packets
/ don't leave the local network unless explicitly requested.
/ Note that this may not have any affect on IPv6 sockets.

defs.name: multicast_hops_v6
defs.docs: Gets the value of the `IPV6_MULTICAST_HOPS` option for this socket

attributes.value: / Gets the value of the `IPV6_MULTICAST_HOPS` option for this socket
/ For more information about this option, see
/ [`set_multicast_hops_v6`][link].
/ [link]: #method.set_multicast_hops_v6

defs.name: set_multicast_hops_v6
defs.docs: Sets the value of the `IPV6_MULTICAST_HOPS` option for this socket

attributes.value: / Sets the value of the `IPV6_MULTICAST_HOPS` option for this socket
/ Indicates the number of "routers" multicast packets will transit for
/ this socket. The default value is 1 which means that multicast packets
/ don't leave the local network unless explicitly requested.

defs.name: multicast_if_v4
defs.docs: Gets the value of the `IP_MULTICAST_IF` option for this socket.

attributes.value: / Gets the value of the `IP_MULTICAST_IF` option for this socket.
/ For more information about this option, see
/ [`set_multicast_if_v4`][link].
/ [link]: #method.set_multicast_if_v4
/ Returns the interface to use for routing multicast packets.

defs.name: set_multicast_if_v4
defs.docs: Sets the value of the `IP_MULTICAST_IF` option for this socket.

attributes.value: / Sets the value of the `IP_MULTICAST_IF` option for this socket.
/ Specifies the interface to use for routing multicast packets.

defs.name: multicast_if_v6
defs.docs: Gets the value of the `IPV6_MULTICAST_IF` option for this socket.

attributes.value: / Gets the value of the `IPV6_MULTICAST_IF` option for this socket.
/ For more information about this option, see
/ [`set_multicast_if_v6`][link].
/ [link]: #method.set_multicast_if_v6
/ Returns the interface to use for routing multicast packets.

defs.name: set_multicast_if_v6
defs.docs: Sets the value of the `IPV6_MULTICAST_IF` option for this socket.

attributes.value: / Sets the value of the `IPV6_MULTICAST_IF` option for this socket.
/ Specifies the interface to use for routing multicast packets. Unlike ipv4, this
/ is generally required in ipv6 contexts where network routing prefixes may
/ overlap.

defs.name: multicast_loop_v6
defs.docs: Gets the value of the `IPV6_MULTICAST_LOOP` option for this socket.

attributes.value: / Gets the value of the `IPV6_MULTICAST_LOOP` option for this socket.
/ For more information about this option, see
/ [`set_multicast_loop_v6`][link].
/ [link]: #method.set_multicast_loop_v6

defs.name: set_multicast_loop_v6
defs.docs: Sets the value of the `IPV6_MULTICAST_LOOP` option for this socket.

attributes.value: / Sets the value of the `IPV6_MULTICAST_LOOP` option for this socket.
/ Controls whether this socket sees the multicast packets it sends itself.
/ Note that this may not have any affect on IPv4 sockets.

defs.name: join_multicast_v4
defs.docs: Executes an operation of the `IP_ADD_MEMBERSHIP` type.

attributes.value: / Executes an operation of the `IP_ADD_MEMBERSHIP` type.
/ This function specifies a new multicast group for this socket to join.
/ The address must be a valid multicast address, and `interface` is the
/ address of the local interface with which the system should join the
/ multicast group. If it's equal to `INADDR_ANY` then an appropriate
/ interface is chosen by the system.

defs.name: join_multicast_v6
defs.docs: Executes an operation of the `IPV6_ADD_MEMBERSHIP` type.

attributes.value: / Executes an operation of the `IPV6_ADD_MEMBERSHIP` type.
/ This function specifies a new multicast group for this socket to join.
/ The address must be a valid multicast address, and `interface` is the
/ index of the interface to join/leave (or 0 to indicate any interface).

defs.name: leave_multicast_v4
defs.docs: Executes an operation of the `IP_DROP_MEMBERSHIP` type.

attributes.value: / Executes an operation of the `IP_DROP_MEMBERSHIP` type.
/ For more information about this option, see
/ [`join_multicast_v4`][link].
/ [link]: #method.join_multicast_v4

defs.name: leave_multicast_v6
defs.docs: Executes an operation of the `IPV6_DROP_MEMBERSHIP` type.

attributes.value: / Executes an operation of the `IPV6_DROP_MEMBERSHIP` type.
/ For more information about this option, see
/ [`join_multicast_v6`][link].
/ [link]: #method.join_multicast_v6

defs.name: linger
defs.docs:
Reads the linger duration for this socket by getting the SO_LINGER
 option

attributes.value: / Reads the linger duration for this socket by getting the SO_LINGER
/ option

defs.docs: Sets the linger duration of this socket by setting the SO_LINGER option

attributes.value: / Sets the linger duration of this socket by setting the SO_LINGER option

defs.name: reuse_address
defs.docs: Check the `SO_REUSEADDR` option on this socket.

attributes.value: / Check the `SO_REUSEADDR` option on this socket.

defs.name: set_reuse_address
defs.docs: Set value for the `SO_REUSEADDR` option on this socket.

attributes.value: / Set value for the `SO_REUSEADDR` option on this socket.
/ This indicates that futher calls to `bind` may allow reuse of local
/ addresses. For IPv4 sockets this means that a socket may bind even when
/ there's a socket already listening on this port.

defs.name: recv_buffer_size
defs.docs: Gets the value of the `SO_RCVBUF` option on this socket.

attributes.value: / Gets the value of the `SO_RCVBUF` option on this socket.
/ For more information about this option, see
/ [`set_recv_buffer_size`][link].
/ [link]: #method.set_recv_buffer_size

defs.name: set_recv_buffer_size
defs.docs: Sets the value of the `SO_RCVBUF` option on this socket.

attributes.value: / Sets the value of the `SO_RCVBUF` option on this socket.
/ Changes the size of the operating system's receive buffer associated
/ with the socket.

defs.name: send_buffer_size
defs.docs: Gets the value of the `SO_SNDBUF` option on this socket.

attributes.value: / Gets the value of the `SO_SNDBUF` option on this socket.
/ For more information about this option, see [`set_send_buffer`][link].
/ [link]: #method.set_send_buffer

defs.name: set_send_buffer_size
defs.docs: Sets the value of the `SO_SNDBUF` option on this socket.

attributes.value: / Sets the value of the `SO_SNDBUF` option on this socket.
/ Changes the size of the operating system's send buffer associated with
/ the socket.

defs.name: keepalive
defs.docs:
Returns whether keepalive messages are enabled on this socket, and if so
 the duration of time between them.

attributes.value: / Returns whether keepalive messages are enabled on this socket, and if so
/ the duration of time between them.
/ For more information about this option, see [`set_keepalive`][link].
/ [link]: #method.set_keepalive

defs.name: set_keepalive
defs.docs: Sets whether keepalive messages are enabled to be sent on this socket.

attributes.value: / Sets whether keepalive messages are enabled to be sent on this socket.
/ On Unix, this option will set the `SO_KEEPALIVE` as well as the
/ `TCP_KEEPALIVE` or `TCP_KEEPIDLE` option (depending on your platform).
/ On Windows, this will set the `SIO_KEEPALIVE_VALS` option.
/ If `None` is specified then keepalive messages are disabled, otherwise
/ the duration specified will be the time to remain idle before sending a
/ TCP keepalive probe.
/ Some platforms specify this value in seconds, so sub-second
/ specifications may be omitted.

defs.name: out_of_band_inline
defs.docs:
Returns the value of the `SO_OOBINLINE` flag of the underlying socket.
 For more information about this option, see [`set_out_of_band_inline`][link].

attributes.value: / Returns the value of the `SO_OOBINLINE` flag of the underlying socket.
/ For more information about this option, see [`set_out_of_band_inline`][link].
/ [link]: #method.set_out_of_band_inline

defs.name: set_out_of_band_inline
defs.docs:
Sets the `SO_OOBINLINE` flag of the underlying socket.
 as per RFC6093, TCP sockets using the Urgent mechanism
 are encouraged to set this flag.

attributes.value: / Sets the `SO_OOBINLINE` flag of the underlying socket.
/ as per RFC6093, TCP sockets using the Urgent mechanism
/ are encouraged to set this flag.
/ If this flag is not set, the `MSG_OOB` flag is needed
/ while `recv`ing to aquire the out-of-band data.

defs.name: new
defs.value: fn (family: c_int, ty: c_int, protocol: c_int) -> io::Result<Socket>

defs.name: recv_from
defs.value: fn (&self, buf: &mut [u8], flags: c_int) -> io::Result<(usize, SockAddr)>

defs.name: send_to
defs.value: fn (&self, buf: &[u8], flags: c_int, addr: &SockAddr) -> io::Result<usize>

defs.name: Domain
defs.docs: Specification of the communication domain for a socket.

attributes.value: / Specification of the communication domain for a socket.
/ This is a newtype wrapper around an integer which provides a nicer API in
/ addition to an injection point for documentation. Convenience constructors
/ such as `Domain::ipv4`, `Domain::ipv6`, etc, are provided to avoid reaching
/ into libc for various constants.
/ This type is freely interconvertible with C's `int` type, however, if a raw
/ value needs to be provided.

defs.name: ipv4
defs.docs: Domain for IPv4 communication, corresponding to `AF_INET`.

attributes.value: / Domain for IPv4 communication, corresponding to `AF_INET`.

defs.name: ipv6
defs.docs: Domain for IPv6 communication, corresponding to `AF_INET6`.

attributes.value: / Domain for IPv6 communication, corresponding to `AF_INET6`.

/ such as `Type::stream`, `Type::dgram`, etc, are provided to avoid reaching
